result.execSummary:
The defendant William A. Petersen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay fine of $200 plus costs including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant William A. Petersen in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:21 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 2 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 - 
Pay fine of $200 plus costs including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan. 

Court advises of 20 days to appeal.
$500 sig bond:   Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant William A. Petersen in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.

Defendant would like to consult with an attorney
Defendant can contact Public Defender for Representation
Court orders defendant to see Public Defender today. 
BTC: $500 sig bond:   Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 10:30 am.
